alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 3:58AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cherokee County through 445 AM CDT... At 358 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Fort Payne to near Tabor Road. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Leesburg, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Cherokee Rock Village, Cornwall Furnace Park, Western Weiss Lake, Blanche, Eastern Weiss Lake, Little River Falls, Weiss Dam, Fullerton, New Moon, Yellow Creek Falls, Chesnut Bay Resort, Broomtown and Howells Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
